name: Quality Inn New River

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very near New River Gorge. this is no doubt what it is overrun with rafters. rooms are dingy, but if you have been on the river all day, perhaps it doesn't matter. If you are not a rafter...don't stay. Noisy, rundown...you get the picture. Go to nearby Beckly for a choice of hotels!
reviews.title: convenient for rafters, maybe, but not great for general public

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing I can say about this hotel is that it really close to the Rivermen whitewater rafting center. Other than that this is a very non-quality Quality Inn.
reviews.title: Try elsewhere
Would stay there again
reviews.text: The room we had was very noisy - we could hear everything from the rooms around us and from outside...no reason to believe the others would be any better. The air-con barely worked and made more noise than startinfg a semi truck in the room! Ditto the bathroom fan.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The advertized free internet is by ethernet cable only - no wifi - and you have to go back to reception to collect a cord since no-one tells you this at check-in. we were greeted as though we were delivering a deadly disease by a receptionist who seemed annoyed that we were disturbing her - especially when we asked about discounts (AAA and AARP are available so ask)
reviews.title: Fair

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is meagre - a buffet coprising a few bagels, some very hard to serve cereals in dispensers and something labelled as coffee.
reviews.title: Nice, clean, convenient
Great staff
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at 1am and was greeted by a wonderful staff member who accomodated us at a great price. The rooms were spotless, the beds comfortable and they had a free continental breakfast with waffles, bagels, cereal, fruit, oatmeal and juice. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel because we found good reviews about it, and we decided to try it. The hotel is located near town; the internet was great! (we used 2 computers, one on wireless and the other was plugged), and the hotels accepts pets (for $10/night).
reviews.title: Convenient to town, great internet!

reviews.text: The room was outdated, and kind of smelly; but again, the internet was a plus for us; and the room came with a big TV, microwave and fridge. The breakfast in the morning was not really that complete; but they have a restaurant on site, and there is many other places in town to eat (Dairy queen is right next door).
reviews.title: Would stay again!

likes.liked: — Location and the fact that they took pets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights, and for the price we paid ($56/night) it was a good deal.
reviews.title: great city, but don't count on getting anything you pay for at this hotel

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights over the 4th of July holiday as we were whitewater raftting on the 4th. We were only a couple miles down the road from our whitewater company and the New River Gorge bridge. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The wireless internet access was really slow. There was a gift shop on the property with reasonable souvenirs. It was also where the continental breakfast was every morning (which was included). This hotel is also pet friendly which is why we picked it. We had a blast whitewater rafting and I am sure we will return to do it again and I won't hesitate to stay here again when we do!!
reviews.title: only hotel in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fayetteville is an absolutely awesome small town full of things to do... but you had better stay somewhere else if you expect friendly and helpful staff. We had booked a ground floor for necessary reasons with a fridge, microwave, and internet. We got NONE of these amenities... when we checked in we asked about all of these things and they said "oh yea, your room has that"... so they out and out lied. Oh yeah, and our key NEVER worked... we got locked out over and over and they made no haste to get us back in late at night in the pouring rain. I highly recommend Fayetteville to any adventurer but save yourself some trouble and stay somewhere a little more hospitable.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a standard off road motel. Has a nice bar/restaurant on site and close to activities. Had no problems but don't expect too much in high quality here. Right place for the price though given the convenience.
reviews.title: basic place with bar restaurant on premises, close to white water rafting (our purpose for going to FAyetteville)

reviews.text: We book at a Comfort Inn down the road, pool was closed, so they moved us to this location. I am not comfortable with doors facing the parking lot, and thats what you have here. The room was dank and so dated. The bathroom door was warped and overall the unit was plain old icky. The kids did get to swim, but the room you had to walk thru to get to the pool, a laundry room was filled with mud on the floor, no towels available. Front desk was nice, but had no clue how to utilized the Choice Priviledges program. It was very close to white water rafting, for that we were glad. The breakfast was good, even though the server looked grouchy.
reviews.title: Room icky - breakfast was the highlite.

reviews.text: Room was nice and free breakfast was good and had good hours. Arrived at night, hotel and parking lot was well lit.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a trip to West Viriginia to go white water rafting. The rafting company, Class IV booked the hotel. It was pet-friendly, quiet, and clean. The staff were all good and helpful.
reviews.title: Friendly, comfortable, convenient - everything we needed.

reviews.text: The rooms do need updating would be my only complaint. The breakfast was typical, the shower was very good and everything seem clean. The service was very good.
reviews.title: Great Value

aka: Quality Inn New River Hotel Fayetteville
